text.base: He doesn't offer you a seat. He's polishing his glasses with a surgical grace. "The police took my statement. It was exhaustive. And exhausting."

lens.believer: The light catching his lenses isn't right. It fractures into spectra that shouldn't exist indoors. He's hiding his eyes because they've seen something impossible.
lens.skeptic: Power move. He's establishing dominance by making you wait. The 'bored intellectual' act is a shield for something rigid and terrified underneath.
lens.haunted: He smells like old earth and ozone. The same smell that was on your clothes when you woke up. He knows what you are.

inserts.text: [REASON - Forensics] Look at his boots. The mud is red clay. That's only found at the North Ridge, not the town paths.
[PRESENCE - Empathy] His pulse is visible in his neck. Rabbit-fast. He's not exhausted; he's running on pure adrenaline.

choices.text: “They missed the mud on your boots, Doctor.”
Say nothing. Just look at the glasses.
[Believer] “You saw the lights, didn't you? That's why your eyes are like that.”
[Theory] “The statement was a fabrication. To protect the project.”

text.base: The polishing stops. He holds the glasses up to the light. "I take walks. Is walking a crime now, Detective? Or do you prefer 'Inquisitor'?"

lens.believer: He's terrified. Not of you. Of what he saw on those walks. The glass trembles in his hand.
lens.skeptic: Defensive pivot. He's countering with aggression to hide a specific location. He doesn't want you going North.
lens.haunted: He's listening to something else. A sound outside the cabin. He thinks *It* followed him back.

lines.speaker: Dr. Keats
lines.text: He puts the glasses back on. The lenses magnify his eyes—too large, too wet. "You're waiting for a crack. A slip. I don't slip."

text.base: "Fine." He sits, finally. The leather chair groans. "The clearing. I saw lights. Not electrical. Biological. Bioluminescence on a macro scale."

lens.believer: "Like angels burning up on reentry. Beautiful and radioactive."
lens.skeptic: "A drone swarm. Or unregistered atmospheric testing. But the color... it was wrong."
lens.haunted: "It looked like the fire. The Blackwood fire. But cold."

choices.text: Note it down. Leave without a word.

lines.speaker: Dr. Keats
lines.text: "Get out of my house. Before I call the Sheriff. He owes me a favor."

text.base: He turns very pale. "You shouldn't say that name. Not here. The wood loves that name."

inserts.text: [INTUITION - Paranormal Sensitivity] The shadows in the corners of the room just lengthened. The house heard you.
[REASON - Logic] 'The Wood loves that name'? Personification of environment. A classic symptom of isolation psychosis. Or a memetic hazard.
